thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Dangers of Everything Becoming a Tech Company

author: Stephen Wilmot
title: Dangers of Everything Becoming a Tech Company

organizations.name: everything becoming a tech company tobacco inc.

text:
Tobacco Inc.’s sudden selloff is a warning flag for companies tempted to pitch Silicon Valley-style tech rather than their traditional business to investors.
Philip Morris International shares fell 16% Thursday—the most since it was spun out of Altria in 2008—after the company warned alongside quarterly results that its new “heat-not-burn” device was selling less rapidly than expected in Japan, the primary test country. Other cigarette makers also got whacked, even though they haven’t pinned their future on the technology...
